task_summary: The robot is instructed to pour into a mug, starting with perception of the mug, aligning above it, executing the pour maneuver, and then retreating.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a robotic arm equipped with a gripper executes a pouring task by first detecting the presence and location of a mug on a work surface. The robot aligns itself above the mug, tilts a held source container over the mug, pours the contents, and then retreats. Object categories involved are a mug (target) and a source container, with all operations occurring on a tabletop in an uncluttered environment. The system follows strict sequential motions, emphasizing reliable perception, safe pouring, and withdrawal.
preconditions: Source container is in robot's gripper and pre-filled.
Mug is present and reachable on the table.
No large obstacles between robot and mug.
Workspace is clear for movement and retreat.
stepwise_plan: Search for and locate the mug on the table.
Move to a pre-pour position above the mug.
Approach and align directly over the mug.
Tilt and pour from the held container into the mug.
Retreat arm from above the mug after pouring.
success_criteria: Source contents poured into mug without spillage.
Robot safely returns to a neutral position post-pour.
failure_and_recovery: If mug not visible: scan up to 3 times.
If pouring does not occur: reissue pour command when safe.
task_long_description.termination: Behavior ends after the robot retreats from above the mug, completing the pour action sequence.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible to the robot sensors
Attempts to visually scan for the mug using an arc search pattern, up to 3 times
Triggers object detection process for the mug
Moves the robot endpoint to a position directly above the mug
Approaches and aligns over the mug to refine positioning
Executes the pouring motion from source container into mug
Retracts the robot away from the mug to a safe distance

recovery_strategy: Retry scanning for mug up to 3 times
Abort and alert if actions repeatedly fail
assumptions: Instruction omits source container; inferred from visual input as held object.
Pour angle and amount not explicit in frames; selected typical parameters.
Timeouts chosen to allow completion, as frames do not encode speed.
No other mugs present; one-to-one mapping assumed.
